block.p: ON THE STREET
New York City
FEAST OF ST. ANTHONY, Mott Street, from Hester to Canal Streets, Little Italy. Today through Monday from 2 to 11:30 p.m. Sponsored by the St. Anthony Society and Most Precious Blood Church.
WASHINGTON SQUARE OUTDOOR ART EXHIBIT, on the sidewalks north, south and east of Washington Square Park, Greenwich Village. Tomorrow through Monday, noon to sundown. Also June 3 and 4, same hours.
ON THE STREET
New York City
FEAST OF ST. ANTHONY, Mott Street, from Hester to Canal Streets, Little Italy. Today through Monday from 2 to 11:30 p.m. Sponsored by the St. Anthony Society and Most Precious Blood Church.
WASHINGTON SQUARE OUTDOOR ART EXHIBIT, on the sidewalks north, south and east of Washington Square Park, Greenwich Village. Tomorrow through Monday, noon to sundown. Also June 3 and 4, same hours.
LOWER THIRD AVENUE SPRING FESTIVAL, from 5th to 14th Streets, Manhattan. Crafts, food and antiques. Tomorrow, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Sponsored by Safe Haven and Two Bridges Neighborhood House.

13TH MEMORIAL DAY WEEKEND MUSIC FESTIVAL, Broadway, from 72nd to 86th Streets. With continuous entertainment as well as crafts and food. Sunday, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Sponsored by the Coalition for a Livable West Side.

18TH CZECH AND SLOVAK FESTIVAL, Bohemian Hall and Park, 29-19 24th Avenue, Astoria, Queens. With entertainment, food and a raffle. Sunday and Monday, noon to 10 p.m. Donation, $8; free for children under 12. Sponsored by the Bohemian Citizens' Benevolent Society of Astoria.
MADISON AVENUE COMMUNITY EXPO, from 32nd to 57th Streets. Crafts, antiques and corporate displays. Monday, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Sponsored by Innovative Community Enterprises.
EVENTS
New York City

FIFTH LOWER EAST SIDE FESTIVAL OF THE ARTS, Theater for the New City, 155 First Avenue, at Ninth Street. A free three-day indoor and outdoor festival featuring theatrical readings, music and dance. Among those taking part are James Earl Jones, Estelle Parsons, Tony Kushner, Eli Wallach, Anne Jackson, Paul Krasner, the Rod Rogers Dance Company, the Thunderbird American Indian Dancers, Mabou Mines and Jean Cocteau Repertory. Hours: today, 6 p.m. to 1 a.m.; tomorrow, 11 a.m. to 1 a.m.; Sunday, 5 p.m. to midnight. Presented by the Theater for the New City. Information: (212) 254-1109.

ROCKEFELLER CENTER. A walking tour exploring the past and future of this Art Deco monument, including its architecture and art. Led by Francis Morrone, an architectural historian. Meets today at 11 a.m. at the Urban Center, 457 Madison Avenue, at 51st Street. Fee: $10; $8 for students, the elderly and members. Sponsored by the Municipal Art Society. Information: (212) 935-3960.

THIRD METROTECH GARDEN FESTIVAL, Metrotech Commons, Myrtle Avenue between Jay Street and Flatbush Avenue Extension, adjacent to the New York Marriott Brooklyn, downtown Brooklyn. Features a 1,000-square-foot chess garden in which games will be held. Also, exhibits presented by the Brooklyn Botanic Garden, the Brooklyn Children's Museum and Barnes & Noble. Hours, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily through next Friday. Information: (718) 488-8200.

MILLENNIUM NATIONAL TAP DANCE DAY AND BLACK FILM FESTIVAL, Adam Clayton Powell Jr. State Office Building, 163 West 125th Street, Harlem. Featuring lectures, screenings and musical performances. Tomorrow, 1 to 4:30 p.m. Admission, $4; $2 for the elderly. Information: (212) 749-5298.

JAPANESE GARDEN REOPENING WEEKEND, Brooklyn Botanic Garden, 1000 Washington Avenue, Crown Heights. Hourly tours tomorrow through Monday, 1 to 4 p.m. Admission $3; $1.50 for students and the elderly; free for children under 16 and for all on Saturdays from 10 a.m. to noon. Information: (718) 623-7200.

''MEMORIAL DAY AND MORE,'' Green-Wood Cemetery, Brooklyn. Jeff Richman, author of ''Brooklyn's Green-Wood Cemetery: New York's Buried Treasure,'' will lead a walk with stops at the graves of Civil War heroes and Leonard Bernstein as well as the highest point in Brooklyn. Meets tomorrow at 1 p.m. at the main entrance of Green-Wood Cemetery, 25th Street and Fifth Avenue, Greenwood Heights, Brooklyn. Fee: $10. Information: (631) 549-4891.

''HISTORIC LOWER MANHATTAN.'' This walking tour explores landmarks and historic sites of Colonial New York, with stops at the first Capitol and a building where George Washington slept. Meets tomorrow at 1 p.m. on the front steps of the Alexander Hamilton U.S. Customs House, 1 Bowling Green. Fee: $10. Sponsored by I'll Take Manhattan Tours. Information: (732) 270-5277.

''BROOKLYN BRIDGE TO BROOKLYN HEIGHTS AT TWILIGHT,'' a walk across the bridge and through one of the city's first suburbs. Meets tomorrow at 5 p.m. on the southeast corner of Broadway and Chambers Streets at City Hall Park in Manhattan. Sponsored by Big Onion Walking Tours. Fee: $10; $8 students and the elderly. Information: (212) 439-1090.

QUEENS JAZZ TRAIL. A bus and walking tour through the neighborhoods of Corona and Flushing and past the former homes of jazz greats, with lunch and a jazz concert. Meets tomorrow at 10 a.m. at Flushing Town Hall, 137-35 Northern Boulevard, Flushing, Queens. Fee: $75; $65 for the elderly and $60 for students. Reservations necessary: (718) 463-7700, extension 222.

''CIVIL WAR NEW YORK,'' Lower Manhattan. A walking tour of sites related to the war, including the site of draft riots and a Confederate prison camp and a stop on the Underground Railroad. Meets tomorrow and Sunday at 5:30 p.m. Sponsored by New York City Discovery Tours. Fee: $12. Information and meeting place: (212) 465-3331.

''SEVENTH HARLEM MEER PERFORMANCE FESTIVAL,'' Central Park. A free two-month festival that runs from 4 to 6 p.m. on Sundays at the Charles A. Dana Discovery Center, Fifth Avenue and 110th Street. This weekend the performers are La Troupe Makandal, a group of Haitian musicians and dancers. Sponsored by the Central Park Conservancy. Information: (212) 860-1370.

''GET DOWN AND DIRTY: DIG, DIG, DIG,'' Marine Park, Brooklyn. Participants can join in an archaeological excavation at an 18th-century house. Sunday at 11 a.m. Fee, $20. Sponsored by the 92nd Street Y. Reservations and meeting place: (212) 996-1100.

''NEW YORK IN WAR AND PEACE,'' Lower Manhattan. A walking tour of sites associated with battles, antiwar demonstrations and peaceful displays, including Fraunces Tavern, the site of the battle of Golden's Hill and the Vietnam Memorial. Meets Monday at 1 p.m. at Murray Street and Broadway at City Hall Park. Fee: $10; students and the elderly, $8. Sponsored by Big Onion Walking Tours. Information: (212) 439-1090.
JEWISH HARLEM. A walking tour that passes synagogues, theaters and residences. Monday at 1 p.m. Fee, $25. Sponsored by the 92nd Street Y. Reservations and meeting place: (212) 996-1100.

''MEMORIAL DAY TOUR OF NEW YORK IN WAR AND PEACE FROM THE AMERICAN REVOLUTIONARY WAR TO THE PRESENT,'' Lower Manhattan. A walking tour visits sites associated with wars from the American Revolution to the 20th century. Meets Monday at 2 p.m. inside Blimpie's Restaurant, 38 Park Row, between Spruce and Beekman Streets. Fee: $12. Sponsored by Dr. Phil: New York Talks and Walks. Information: (888) 377-4455.

ANNUAL MEMORIAL DAY CONCERT, Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine, 1047 Amsterdam Avenue, at 112th Street, Morningside Heights. Featuring the New York Philharmonic in a performance of Bruckner's Symphony No. 7 conducted by Kurt Masur. Monday at 8 p.m. Free. Information: (212) 875-5709.

MEMORIAL DAY WEEKEND CELEBRATION, Intrepid Sea-Air-Space Museum, Pier 86, West 46th Street and 12th Avenue. With a number of free events including a Navy Seals rescue demonstration tomorrow at 1 p.m.; tours of visiting vessels tomorrow through Monday from 1 to 4 p.m.; U.S.O. concerts on Sunday at 1, 3 and 4 p.m.; and a Memorial Day ceremony on Monday at 11 a.m. Events on board the Intrepid Museum require admission: $12; $9 for students, veterans, reservists and the elderly; $6 for children 6 to 11 years old; $2 for children 2 to 5 years old; free for children under 2. Information: (212) 245-0072.

GOLDMAN MEMORIAL BAND, Green-Wood Cemetery, Fifth Avenue and 25th Street, Greenwood Heights, Brooklyn. A free concert of music with ties to performers buried at the cemetery, including the composers Leonard Bernstein and Louis Moreau Gottschalk. Monday at 2 P.M. Information: (212) 807-4915.
Hudson Valley

WESTCHESTER COUNTY FAIR, Yonkers Raceway, Central and Yonkers Avenues, Exit 2, off the Thomas E. Dewey Thruway, Yonkers. Weekend hours: today, 5 p.m. to midnight; tomorrow through Monday, noon to midnight. Through June 11. Admission, $6; free for children under four feet tall; parking, $4. Information: (914) 968-4200.

ANIMALS AND ACROBATS FESTIVAL, Van Cortlandt Manor, off Route 9 in Croton-on-Hudson. Elephant and camel rides, and a magician, juggler, rope walker, puppeteer and others. Tomorrow through Monday, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Admission: $8; $7 for people 60 and older and $4 for children 5 through 17. Additional $4 for animal rides and purchase of picnic foods. Information: (914) 271-8981.

''QUILTERS,'' Depot Theater, Garrison Landing. A play presented by the Philipstown Players. Today and tomorrow at 8 p.m. and Sunday at 5 p.m. Tickets: $12 for adults, $10 for older people and children under 12. Information: (914) 265-2797.
JAZZ PERFORMANCE, 1 Station Plaza, 38 North Division Street, Peekskill. With Dave Finucane, a saxophonist, and his quintet. Today at 9 p.m.. Tickets: $10. Information: (914) 736-1053.

NATURE AND BIRDING PROGRAMS, Teatown Lake Reservation, 1600 Spring Valley Road, Ossining. A nature program for children, tomorrow from 10 a.m. to noon for children 8 and 9 and from 1 to 3 p.m. for children 10 to 12. Cost: $8; members, $6. A free birding program for adults will be offered tomorrow from 9 to 11 a.m. Registration is necessary for both: (914) 762-2912.

RYE PLAYLAND, Playland Park hours: today, 6 p.m. to midnight; tomorrow, noon to 11 p.m.; Sunday and Memorial Day, noon to 8 p.m. Summer hours begin on June 24. Parking: $7 on holidays; weekends, $5; today, $4. Tickets for rides: $8 for 12-ticket book; $15 for 24-ticket book; $19 for 36-ticket book. Rides cost 3 to 6 tickets each. Information: (914) 925-2700.

WALKING TOUR OF OSSINING. Covers the historic Sparta section. Led by John Lee, a resident and local historian. Meets tomorrow at 1 p.m at the Jug Tavern, 74 Revolutionary Road, Ossining. Free. Information: (914) 945-0674.

ANNUAL MEMORIAL DAY FAIR, 111 Spring Street, South Salem. 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. A 10-kilometer race at 9:30 a.m.; a 5-kilometer race at 9:45; a 4.3-kilometer walk at 9:40 a.m.; plus races for children 7 and under. Registration is from 8:30 to 9:15 a.m. Fee: $13; $5 for young children's races; Food, crafts, antiques and a silent auction will be featured, and a parade begins at the Town House at 11:30 a.m. Information: (914) 763-9282.

MAPLEBROOK SCHOOL ART SHOW, Rossman Hall, off Route 22, Amenia. Featuring works by more than 60 artists. Hours: today, 5 to 8 p.m.; tomorrow through Monday, 10:30 a.m. to 3 p.m. Also June 2 and 3, 10:30 a.m. to 3 p.m. Information: (914) 373-9511, extension 46.
New Jersey

CAPE MAY MUSIC FESTIVAL, Convention Hall, Beach Drive at Stockton Place, Cape May. With Bruce Molsky and the Big Hoedown, a traditional folk and country band. Sunday at 8 p.m. Tickets, $20; $10 for the elderly; $5 for students. Information: (800) 275-4278.

OCEAN GROVE SUMMER CONCERT SERIES, the Great Auditorium, two blocks from the ocean at the intersection of Pilgrim and Ocean Pathways, Ocean Grove. The Monmouth Symphony Orchestra. Tomorrow at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $20 for reserved seats, $18 for general admission; free for children 12 and younger in the general section ($10 in the reserved section). Information: (732) 988-0645 or (800) 773-0097.
STYX, REO SPEEDWAGON, EDDIE MONEY, PNC Bank Arts Center, Exit 116 off the Garden State Parkway, Holmdel. Sunday at 7 p.m. Tickets: $17.50 to $45. Information: (201) 507-8900.
BLUES-ROCK SHOW, Stanhope House, 45 Main Street, Stanhope. With Billy Hector and The Fairlanes, rockin' blues. Tonight at 10. Tickets: $6. Information: (973) 347-0458.
NIGHT WALK, Morris County Parks, Great Swamp Outdoor Education Center, 247 Southern Boulevard, Chatham. Tomorrow at 8 p.m. Free. Information: (973) 635-6629.

JURIED AMERICAN INDIAN ARTS FESTIVAL, Rankokus Indian Reservation, Westhampton. (Exit 5 off New Jersey Turnpike, exit 45A off Interstate 295.) With 150 American Indian artists and entertainers, representing 50 tribes. Tomorrow, Sunday and Monday, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Sponsored by the Powhatan Renape Nation. Admission: $10; $5 for children 6 to 12 and older people; free for children under 6. Information: (609) 261-4747.

GIANT MODEL AIR SHOW, Warren Kruse field in the Assunpink Wildlife Management Area, near Imlaystown. Annual Giant Scale Model Airplane ''Fly-in.'' Tomorrow and Sunday, beginning at 9 a.m. Free. Information: (609) 409-7530.

''LASER SPACE QUEST 3-D,'' New Jersey State Museum, 205 West State Street, Trenton. Planetarium laser light show. Tomorrow and Sunday at 1 and 3 p.m. Through June 25. Tickets: $6 includes 3-D glasses. Information: (609) 292-6464.
Connecticut
75TH ANNIVERSARY CONCERT OF THE COAST GUARD BAND, Leamy Auditorium, Coast Guard Academy, 15 Mohegan Avenue, New London. Sunday at 7:30 p.m. Free.

''THE ART OF BLOOMSBURY,'' Yale Center for British Art, 1080 Chapel Street, New Haven. Works imagining artists and intellectuals in early 20th-century London, by Vanessa Bell, Duncan Grant and their contemporaries, Today and tomorrow, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sunday, noon to 5 p.m. Through Sept. 3. Free. Information: (203) 432-2800.

''JUNGLE BOOK,'' Downtown Cabaret Theater, 263 Golden Hill Street, Bridgeport. A musical based on the Kipling story. Tomorrow, noon and 2:30 p.m.; Sunday at noon. Tickets, $10.50. Bring picnic lunch. Information: (203) 576-1636.

MEMORIAL DAY BOOK FAIR, Kent Library, Route 7, Kent. With an art exhibition, boutiques, band music, entertainment. Tomorrow, beginning at 10 a.m.; Sunday at noon; and Monday at 10 a.m. There will be a parade on Monday beginning at 9 a.m. Information: (860) 927-3761.

MYSTIC SEAPORT'S MEMORIAL DAY LOBSTERFEST, 75 Greenmanville Avenue, off Exit 90 of Interstate 95, Mystic. Tomorrow, Sunday and Monday, 11:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. Lobster, coleslaw, corn on the cob, roll, iced tea or lemonade and a bib, priced according to lobster size. Admission: $16 for adults, $8 for children 6 to 12, free to children under 6 (plus cost of food). Information: (888) 973-2767.

MARINE LIFE STUDY CRUISES. Departs from Maritime Aquarium dock, 10 North Water Street, Norwalk. Through Labor Day, two-and-one-half-hour cruises on Long Island Sound, Saturdays and Sundays at 1 p.m. Tickets, $17.50. Information: (203) 852-0700, extension 206.
Long Island

SOUTH BAY ART ASSOCIATION'S 43RD ANNUAL MEMBERS EXHIBIT, Bellport Community Center, Bell Street, Bellport. 150 works of art by 60 local member artists. Tomorrow and Sunday, noon to 6 p.m.; Monday, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Free. Information: (631) 286-1136.
24TH ANNUAL 10-MILE RUN, Magnolia Boulevard and Park Avenue, Long Beach. Sunday at 8 a.m. Fee: $15 in advance, $20 on race day. Information: (516) 431-3890.
''101 DALMATIANS,'' Cultural Arts Playhouse, 714 Old Bethpage Road, Old Bethpage. A musical. Tomorrow at 1 p.m. Saturdays through June 24. Tickets: $7. Information: (516) 694-3330.

''POTATOHAMPTON 10-K MINITHON,'' Presbyterian Church, Main Street, Bridgehampton. A 10-kilometer run to raise money for National Multiple Sclerosis. Tomorrow at 9:30 a.m.; registration at 7 a.m. Fee: $15. Information: (631) 329-5480.
''CLASSIC ANTIQUES SHOW,'' Elks Field, Montauk Highway, Southampton. 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Today through Sunday. Admission: $5. Information: (631) 261-4590

''ITALIAN FESTIVAL,'' Plattdeutsche Park, Hempstead Turnpike, Franklin Square. Today, 6 to 11 p.m.; tomorrow through Monday, 3 to 11 p.m. Free. Sponsored by America Lodge (a branch of Sons of Italy). Information: (516) 897-0037.
PORT WASHINGTON ANTIQUES AND COLLECTIBLES STREET FAIR, Lower Main Street. Sunday, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Information: (516) 883-1210.

''BELLO AND FRIENDS,'' C. W. Post Campus, Long Island University, Brookville. Big Apple Circus. Tonight at 6:30; tomorrow and Sunday at noon and 4 p.m. Through June 4. Tickets: $35, $28 and $20. Information: (516) 299-3100.

ANNUAL RENAISSANCE FAIR, the Castle, 109 Browns Road, Huntington. With music, dance, storytelling, juggling and mime. Tomorrow, 11 a.m. to 7 p.m.; Sunday, 11 a.m to 6 p.m. Admission, $8; $5 for students and the elderly; $2 for children under 12; free for children under 2. Information: (631) 427-9547.
